maqras.text: And, indeed, Abraham was of his ilk
When he came to his Lord with a sound mind
When he said to his father and his people, "What is it that you worship
Do you desire to perpetrate the lie that there are gods besides Allah
What do you then think about the Lord of all the worlds
He then cast a glance at the stars
And said, "I am sick indeed
So they turned away from him
Then he secretly turned to their gods and asked them, "Don't you eat
What is the matter with you that you do not speak
Then, unseen by anyone, he turned upon them, hitting them with his right hand
Then they (the people) came rushing to him
He (Abraham) asked, "Do you worship that which you (yourselves) carve out
And Allah has created you and your work
They (the people) said, "Cast him (Abraham) into the flaming fire from a structure specially built for him
And they devised a plan against him, but We brought them down
And he (Abraham) said, "I do indeed betake myself to my Lord — He will guide me
My Lord, grant me a righteous son
So We gave him the good news of a gentle and kind son

And then when he (son) grew up to be able to work with him, he (Abraham) said, "O my son! I have seen in a dream that I sacrifice you. Now consider how you see it." He (son) said, "O my father! Act upon what is commanded to you. Allah willing, you will find me patient
And then when they had both submitted to Allah's Will, and he (Abraham) had laid him (son) upon his forehead
And We called out to him, "O Abraham
You have certainly fulfilled the obligation laid upon you in the vision. We do thus reward the good people
This is indeed the trial manifest
And We ransomed him (Abraham) with a great sacrifice
And left on him [the salutation] among the later generations
Peace upon Abraham
We do thus reward the good people
He was indeed one of Our believing worshippers
And We gave him the good news of (his son) Isaac, (who would also be) a prophet from among the righteous people
And We bestowed blessings on him and on Isaac. And of their offspring some have been good, but some, evidently unjust to themselves
And We did certainly confer a favour on Moses and Aaron
And We saved them both and their people from the great grief
And We helped them, and then they were the ones with the upper hand
And We gave them both the Book (Torah) that made things clear
And We guided them on the Straight Path
And left on them both [the salutation] among the later generations
Peace upon Moses and Aaron
Thus do We indeed reward the good people
They both were indeed among Our believing subjects
And Elias (Elijah) was indeed among those sent as Messengers
When he asked his people, "Are you not scared of wrongful living
Do you pray to Ba'l (idol worshipped by Elias' people) and forsake the Best of the creators —
— Allah, your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers
But they rejected him (Elias), so they shall indeed certainly be presented (for punishment before the Lord)
Excpt for those who worship Allah alone devotedly
And We left on him [the salutation] among the later generations
Peace upon Elias
We do indeed thus reward the good people
He was indeed among Our believing subjects
And Lot was certainly indeed one of those sent as Allah's Messengers
When We saved him and his family, all —
Except for an old woman who was left among those who remained behind
Then We destroyed the others [— other than those saved]
And you do indeed pass by them in the mornings
And at night. Do you not then understand
And Jonah was certainly indeed one of those sent as Allah's Messengers
When he ran away to the laden ship
And then he (Jonas) embarked the ship with others but was one of those thrown overboard (into the sea)
And then the big fish swallowed him and he was himself to blame
But had he not indeed been of those who glorify (Allah)
He would have remained in its belly till the Day people are resurrected
